{"step_by_step_thinking": "Immunologically active cells are cells that play a role in the immune response. Plasma cells, derived from B lymphocytes, produce antibodies that are used to neutralize pathogens, as mentioned in Document [1]. MAST cells are a type of white blood cell that plays a crucial role in allergic reactions, but they are not mentioned in the provided documents. Eosinophils are a type of white blood cell that are involved in the immune response, particularly in response to parasitic infections and allergic reactions, but they are also not mentioned in the documents. Red Blood Cells (R.B.Cs) are not involved in the immune response; their primary function is to transport oxygen from the lungs to the body's tissues.", "answer_choice": "A"}
